title: Anyone want to strategise about world pickems?

replies.body: I'm curious as to why you have intz 2nd?

I'll go ahead and be the first to address the elephant in the room : )

What makes you say that SKT will come third in group B? Most people would put them either first (based on their past performance to put it lightly) or second after Cloud 9 (like our very own [Rusty](http://www.lolesports.com/en_US/articles/rustys-guide-group-b) did). What have you heard about the Flash Wolves that the rest of us haven't? Spill the beans friend!
Care to explain what **distinguished member** is?
Even though I know you've already seen the announcement post, a distinguished member is a Boards Volunteer that hasn't become specialised into a program (such as Emissary or Instructor).

No beans, but I'll share my simple mindset.
I feel that SKT relies on Faker as their MVP to set up plays for their jungler/rest of team though not having that synergy wtih Blank that he hand with Bengi whose gameplay revolved around his team's capabilities rather than individual plays.
So I'm taking a wild gamble for Flash Wolves, who have one of the oldest rosters, to snowball their way to first place(though unlikely)seeing how none of the teams are the most organised in this year's pool.

I've always felt that SKT was one of the strongest macro teams because even if they fall behind they know how to stall out the game and outmanoeuvre the enemy when it counts. Also, it often feels they play reactively and snap you up when you overstep. Still, you're right it isn't the same line-up and it's most **definitely** not the same opposition this year. 

I applaud you for taking a gamble. 99% of people are eliminated by one upset so best of luck to you and the Flash Wolves!
